[CFN] A thousand words

So this is what happened.

Just over a year ago, I got my wife a digital camera. The preferred setting produces JPEG files of about 500k, average. Yes, yes, I can tickle the resolution and fool with formats, blah blah blah. I'm not interested in that - we experiemented and fooled with it, and the optimal setting for the kinds of photos we take with this camera produces these images.

So, fast-forward to today. I have about 4 gigabytes of files. My entire existence can be inferred from these 6000+ JPEG files, as well as a plethora of details of others' lives. There are dozens of so-called "image management" programs - most suck terribly. I've whittled my requirements down to a few basic bullet points, and am writing my own software to backup, organize and display all this stuff. So what's the problem?

I need THUMBNAILS. Like, 6000 of them. And jillions more going forward. Does anyone know of any software that chows through JPEG files and produces a low-res, shrunken copy of the original?

I'm setting this whole thing up for the future, because I can only imagine when the rest of the family starts carrying picture cell phones, discovers astronomy, or biology, or fashion competitions, or raves, and suddenly I have terrabytes of images to manage. My software will scale (it HAS to) but it all falls apart when I have to thumbnail everything manually using Photoshop. I suppose I could outsource it to India, but I'm not too crazy about letting anyone else get ahold of my personal (gasp! No! Not THAT personal! Shame on you!) images.

Comments and suggestions are greatly appreciated.

Re's,
MC
-------

always on the outisde
looking in
on other's lives
       - indigo girls
